h4.strong: Polk County Schools will use this site to share updated information about our response to the COVID-19 virus.

div.div: Please check out our new Student Activities site
Click here to read the content of recent messages.
Answers to family's frequently asked questions.
Haz click aquí para leer el contenido de los mensajes recientes.
Parent resources to help with reading.
Subscribe to Polk County Messages
Breakfast & lunch available for pickup at elementary schools.
Free WiFi locations at Schools and Libraries
Charter Communications is offering free internet access to families.
AT&T announced additional service options for students.
Polk County COVID-19 Resources
Information on habits to keep yourself healthy.

div.h3: What To Do if You Are Sick
div.div: Steps to help prevent the spread of COVID-19 if you are sick
The best way to prevent illness is to avoid being exposed to this virus.
What to do if you are sick
To help those who are seeking info about St. Luke’s visitor restrictions.
Information about telehealth services (phone and video counseling sessions).
Current Information about Covid-19 in North Carolina.
Current information about Covid-19 nationally.
Facebook site for the CDC.
Facebook site for the NCDHHS.
Specific information for state employees.
Johns Hopkins Covid 19 Data Map

p.a: NASN Coronavirus Resources for School Nurses

div.p:
School Board Chair:
Mr. Rick Covil

div.div: © 2019 Polk County Schools

Polk County School System does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, disability, or age in its programs and activities. The following person has been designated to handle inquiries regarding the nondiscrimination policies: Rachael Haynes-Wood, Personnel Department.
